snippet: Girls are not urged to play with toy kitchens, and blocks are not considered toys for boys. When boys hurt themselves, teachers give them as much comforting as they would girls. Everyone gets to play with dolls. The Nicolaigarden, a taxpayer-financed...
abstract: Girls are not urged to play with toy kitchens, and blocks are not considered toys for boys. When boys hurt themselves, teachers give them as much comforting as they would girls. Everyone gets to play with dolls. The Nicolaigarden, a taxpayer-financed preschool, is a compelling example of Sweden’s efforts to blur gender lines and, theoretically, cement opportunities for both women and men.
lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM—Girls are not urged to play with toy kitchens, and wooden or Lego blocks are not considered toys for boys. And when boys hurt themselves, teachers are taught to give them every bit as much comforting as they would girls. Everyone gets to play with dolls, and while most are anatomically correct, some are also black.

headline.main: At a Swedish Preschool, No ‘He’ or ‘She’
